title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
The drug Adcetris accounted for $706 million of Seagen Inc.'s $1.4 billion in sales last year. A Page One article on Thursday about Merck & Co.'s talks to acquire Seagen incorrectly said Adcetris alone had $1.4 billion of sales last year. The error also appeared in a June 18 Page One article and a June 24 Business & Finance article about the companies.

(See: "Merck Nears $40 Billion Deal For Cancer Biotech Seagen" -- WSJ July 7, 2022"; "Merck Pursues Biotech Seagen To Bolster Its Cancer Portfolio" -- WSJ June 18, 2022"; "Merck Presses Ahead With Seagen" -- WSJ June 24, 2022)

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
